Of course! Here are some sci-fi movie recommendations based on your interest:

1. Blade Runner (1982) - A classic sci-fi movie that explores themes of humanity and what it means to be alive.
2. The Matrix (1999) - A groundbreaking film that delves into the nature of reality and the impact of technology on society.
3. Inception (2010) - A mind-bending movie that explores the concept of shared dreaming and the blurring of reality and fantasy.
4. Interstellar (2014) - A visually stunning film that delves into the mysteries of space travel, time dilation, and the search for a new habitable planet.
5. Ex Machina (2014) - A psychological sci-fi thriller that explores the ethics of artificial intelligence and the blurring of lines between man and machine.
6. Her (2013) - A thought-provoking film that explores the relationship between a man and an operating system designed to meet his every need, raising questions about what it means to be human.
7. The Terminator (1984) - A classic sci-fi action movie that introduces the concept of a cyborg assassin sent back in time to kill the future leader of the human resistance.
8. Minority Report (2002) - A futuristic thriller that explores the themes of pre-crime and the ethics of manipulating the future.
9. Elysium (2013) - A visually stunning film set in a dystopian future where the wealthy live in a pristine, high-tech paradise while the rest of society lives on a polluted, overcrowded planet.
10. Children of Men (2006) - A thought-provoking film set in a world where humanity has lost the ability to procreate, exploring themes of hope, despair, and the power of human connection.

I hope you find something that interests you in this list!
